messages.message:
On UAT when connecting a Google Drive, we’re still showing Organization members as a valid option when selecting the audience. It’s blocked at the connection step but ideally I shouldn’t be able to select Organization members if it’s not supported.

(I think cc @Xindi Xu as it’s related to https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/CS-5383)
We do allow mounting org google drives. The button is disabled because the form is not yet valid – you need to enter a name first

Oh well then my bad then and I guess the docs are wildly out of date--they still said it can only be connected as a workspace drive. The button is active without naming the drive when you select workspace members, so I guess that contributed to my confusion.
yea, the workspace drive has name auto-populated so the form is valid to start with.
okey ty ty, and I’ll update docs to say that we support google drive as an organization drive too.
Actually, i could be wrong with that we are supporting org drives.
Is this a Cheryl question? @Cheryl Zhou :pray: could you confirm if we support Google Drive as an org drive? did we change that at some point?

@mfichman We are shipping the new data sources UI. 3 functionality changes in the new UI
1. We allow mounting Google org drives. Mounting drive works, but users can't really access the drive, right? 
2. Google drives have a "drive filter" field now. Do we need to hide them or is it okay to keep?
3. Can Google cloud storage be an org drive?
I get this on UAT when trying to connect my Instabase account Google Drive as an org drive so that’s no help.
google drive can't be an org drive; google cloud storage is okay (although we never did the UI for GCS)
can you try with a different name?
I tried a few names, same thing
We do have the UI for both Google and GCS being an org drive
@Rosie i actually saw the drive you just mounted
fascinating
i see. maybe things changed with more recent work on google drives now :sweat_smile: will let @mfichman confirm

@shikhar, Could you help take a look at this? I think this is related to your work on Google OAuth tokens (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/62086). The drives are mounted properly but the user are brought to the error page saying that the mount point name exists already.

The URL is:
Mounting Google Workspace drive
https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/google-auth/drive/callback?state=QIi1TEqtRVvwyqE7GXX[…]ww.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.user.readonly (https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/google-auth/drive/callback?state=QIi1TEqtRVvwyqE7GXXNTNaJoVTyp8&code=4/0AVG7fiRpst0so93ZoDjET4TCD_L8LL1_fOJ3epRoHl1Z-AUlpkOv3882LFXfHpt_lxYfQw&scope=https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive%20https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.group.readonly%20https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.orgunit.readonly%20https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.user.readonly)

Mounting Google Org drive
https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/google-auth/drive/callback?state=Bb6l1oBDS4VcZvyrOfR[…]ww.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.user.readonly (https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/google-auth/drive/callback?state=Bb6l1oBDS4VcZvyrOfRwMfWKuEcSx8&code=4/0AVG7fiQHNdNT4Zp9A4AqGo2qUCvvUXVsneAEofLiwoCpkfcEPxHIsVkhXjS5KM-rJme5Tw&scope=https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive%20https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.group.readonly%20https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.orgunit.readonly%20https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.user.readonly)
We are supporting GCS as org drives on prod rn, so the answer to my #3 Q would be yes.
Don't think this should've changed. We don't support Google drive as an org drive.

Not exactly organization drives, but rationale is we actually don't have full file-system support for Google drive. Some more discussion here https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1727439802861029
